title: How to Copy the Same Text to Multiple Cells in Excel: Desktop & Mobile

steps.title: Type the value into an empty cell.
steps.content: Type the value into an empty cell. For example, if you want the word "wikiHow" to appear in multiple cells, type wikiHow into any empty cell now. Use this method if you want the same value to appear in an entire range.

steps.title: Right-click the cell containing the value and select Copy.
steps.content: Right-click the cell containing the value and select Copy . This copies the value to your clipboard. Alternatively, you can press Ctrl + C on Windows or ⌘ Cmd + C on Mac.

steps.title: Select the range of cells where you want to paste the value.
steps.content: Select the range of cells where you want to paste the value. To do this, click and drag the mouse over every cell where the value should appear. This highlights the range. The range you select doesn't have to be continuous. If you want to select cells and/or ranges that aren't connected, hold down the Control key (PC) or Command key (Mac) as you highlight each range.

steps.title: Right-click the highlighted range and click Paste.
steps.content: Right-click the highlighted range and click Paste . Every cell in the selected range now contains the same value. Alternatively, you can press Ctrl + V on Windows or ⌘ Cmd + V on Mac.

steps.title: Type the value into an empty cell.
steps.content: Type the value into an empty cell. For example, if you want the word "wikiHow" to appear in multiple cells, type wikiHow into an empty cell above (if applying to a column) or beside (if applying to a row) the cells you want to fill.

steps.title: Tap the cell once to select it.
steps.content: Tap the cell once to select it. This highlights the cell.

steps.title: Tap the highlighted cell once more.
steps.content: Tap the highlighted cell once more. This opens the Edit menu.

steps.title: Tap the copy button on the menu.
steps.content: Tap the copy button on the menu. The copy button looks like two sheets of paper. Now that the value is copied to your clipboard, you'll be able to paste it into a series of other cells.

steps.title: Select the range of cells in which you want the selected value to appear.
steps.content: Select the range of cells in which you want the selected value to appear. To do so, tap the first cell where you want the copied value to appear, and then drag the dot at its bottom-right corner to select the entire range. There is no way to select multiple non-touching ranges at once. If you need to copy the value into another non-adjacent range, repeat this step and the next step for the next range after pasting into this one.

steps.title: Tap the selected range and tap Paste.
steps.content: Tap the selected range and tap Paste . This copies the selected value into every cell in the range.

steps.title: Type the value into an empty cell.
steps.content: Type the value into an empty cell. For example, if you want the word "wikiHow" to appear in multiple cells, type wikiHow into an empty cell above (if applying to a column) or beside (if applying to a row) the cells you want to fill.

steps.title: Hover the mouse cursor over the bottom-right corner of the cell.
steps.content: Hover the mouse cursor over the bottom-right corner of the cell. The cursor will turn to crosshairs (+).

steps.title: Click and drag down the column or across the row to fill all cells.
steps.content: Click and drag down the column or across the row to fill all cells. As long as Excel does not detect a pattern, all selected cells will be filled with the same value. If the filled cells show up as a pattern, such as a series of increasing numbers, click the icon with a plus sign at the bottom of the selected cells, then select Copy cells .

steps.title: Type the value into an empty cell.

steps.title: Tap the highlighted cell once more.
steps.content: Tap the highlighted cell once more. This opens the Edit menu.

steps.title: Tap Fill on the menu.
steps.content: Tap Fill on the menu. You will then see some arrow icons.

steps.title: Tap and drag the Fill arrow across the cells you want to fill.
steps.content: Tap and drag the Fill arrow across the cells you want to fill. If you want to fill a row, tap the arrow pointing to the right and drag it until you're finished filling all of the cells. If you're filling a column, tap the arrow pointing downward, then drag it down to fill the desired number of cells.
